data.title: Best breakfast
data.text:
This restaurant is one of our favorites for a great breakfast.  Great waitstaff, large portions, fresh food, great presentation.  Give these guys a try.....You won't be disappointed

Wt Cote

data.title: Excellent!!
data.text: We visit here at least once a week. There pizza is awesome. Everything we have tried here is great! They are always consistent. Staff is awesome and always friendly!

data.title: Lack of service
data.text: We go often, food is always excellent. Service is typically good, just on the slow side. Tonight they were busy, however the waitress continued to talk excessively about personal life, causing an unnecessary delay. She spoke for 6 minutes to at least one table about personal items, we thought they were ordering..but they were leaving.  There was two young men waiting ahead of us and a table that came in after us. Young girl brought our drinks, then we waited, after 25 minutes our order was still not taken. She then took the table that came in last...we gave up and left. Good food or not, doesn't do a thing if we can't get any of it. If you go, avoid the section with the waitress wearing short hair and high top sneakers. She may be nice, but they close at 9.

owner_response.author: Karen F, Owner at Alvaros, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I apologize for your poor service, the server in question has been approached and coached regarding this situation.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you.

Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Take out pizza
data.text: We moved to the area recently. Seeking a new pizza place. We found it. Pizza was great the antipasto salad was huge,fresh and the homemade dressing was perfect.

data.title: ALWAYS CROWDED DURING SNOW BIRD SEASON ...
data.text: My husband & I ate at Alvaro's since so many of the seniors in our community recommended it.  It was VERY inexpensive (less than $20 for both of us).  My husband had the spaghetti & meatballs special.  The meatballs were tasty & the sauce was good.  I had soup (which was delicious) and an open-faced turkey sandwich which was OK at best.  The mashed potatoes and gravy were good but the turkey had little flavor and if I had been blindfolded when I ate it, I couldn't have identified the meat as turkey.  Still...it's always crowded and there was a line of 20+ people waiting outside when we left.  If you decide to try it, I would definitely stick with the specials!  The service was very good and they have a fairly large dining room but get there early if you don't like to wait.  The older crowd loves it!

data.title: Great Value for good food
data.text:
WE moved from North Port to a nearby town. The only place we miss is ALVARO"S !
Many Saturdays we went there for breakfast. The service was always excellent, the food very good ( especially the grits), and the prices were always reasonable.
We still return but not as often & really DO MISS the Alvaro"s experience.

data.title: Casual Dining
data.text: Good service with tasty food.  Friendly, casual dining.  Extensive menu with daily specials. Inexpensive items available.

data.title: good filling food
data.text: This place has great daily specials. Prices are good, You will leave full. Service is good, I absolutely love the turkey soup. Wish they they served it more often. Even my picky husband loves it. Sometimes we call ahead to see if they have that and it helps decide where we are eating.  We also enjoy the spaghetti, stromboli, fish tacos, alfredo, quesadillas and more

data.title: Nothing fancy but good food.
data.text: Great local restaurant. Nothing fancy.  Service friendly . Waitress knows your name due to repeat business. Greek diner atmosphere. Daily specials are very reasonable. Great Greek food and Pizza. Best calzones around stuffed with ricotta.  Old timers fill this place up for the daily specials. Good breakfast. Come early.

data.title: Great food
data.text: They have a nice variety of good meals however I love their corned beef and cabbage special. The meat loaf is also quite good.

data.title: Good... needs some work with staff
data.text: I was at Alvaros the other day for dinner .. I normally come in the mornings, the food is wonderful all around. Normally I don't have a problem with what the uniform for the staff is because all restaurants are different but there was this one girl who walked into Alvaros and I thought it was a customer but I ended up finding out she was working there and she looked like a mess. Wearing what seemed to be her pajamas I don't even think she was wearing a bra. She didn't match the other staff members at all. It was just very unprofessional in my opinion.

owner_response.author: Karen F, Owner at Alvaros, responded to this review
owner_response.text: The issue regarding the employee has been resolved.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: We had the place to ourselves...
data.text: We stopped by on the way to shopping in North Port, saw this place was #4 on Trip Advisor, and decided to have breakfast.  Since it was off season, the place was empty, but soon the regulars started dropping in, but our waitress never missed a beat.  We left full and seemed as if we spent half of what we had expected.  The pancakes were great, as was the coffee, and the egg dishes were cooked to order.  The folks that work there were as friendly as can be.  Clean and welcoming.  Glad we ate here.  Let's see them go to #1.

data.title: Great Food, friendly people and awesome prices!
data.text: This is a down to earth, nothing fancy, fantastic restaurant.  We are snowbirds and we eat here often.  Monday, they have a pizza and salad special,and Weds, they have a spaghetti special both are great!  I've also had their liver and onions...very tender and flavorful.  I've also had lunch...chicken parm sandwich...very good.  I've heard their breakfasts are awesome but haven't had a chance to try them yet.

data.title: Sunday breakfast
data.text: Always a favorite for Sunday breakfast when visiting family! The buffet is a plus😊. The servers are always welcoming and remember faces!

data.title: Friendly, Spotless and Tasty
data.text: Tucked away in a mini-mall, Alvaro's is a real find because of its family-owned influence, cleanliness, friendly staff and food selection - from a tasty weekend breakfast buffet to an all-day choice of multiple menu items at affordable prices. Off the beaten trail (slightly), it is worth the fork in the road.

data.title: Some things never change
data.text: Been a couple of years since we dined at Alvaros.  I had chicken parm and it came with soup or salad. Parm was edible ,but, nothing special. Salad was iceburg lettuce and a piece of tomato and cuke and a dressing that I think was bottled.  Hubby opted for pasta with white sauce and some kind of seafood and clam chowder.  He ate the chowder,but,said it was not what he would order again.  He had a few bites of the pasra and couldn,t finish the rest.  He said there was just nothing good about it,  the place was not very clean.  Dirt on the chair rail .  I wiped down the salt and pepper shakers with my hand wipes.

data.title: Local Gem
data.text: Good, casual homemade food. Good breakfast, sanwiches and salads. They have nightly dinner specials and very good italian items ansd pizza. This is not a quiet trendy place but more like a bustling diner vibe.

data.title: Don't judge a book
data.text: Tiny place in a strip center, limited parking and no ambience. That being said, the food, serving size and prices are the bomb. Great food for cheap.

data.title: quick breakfast
data.text: Its close to where I live in North Port. The breakfasts are good. Its a family style restaurant the servings are large and the service is fast. Sometimes there could be a waiting line.

data.title: Breakfast at Alvaros
data.text: We have a very large biking club who have breakfast every Thursday at Alvaro's.  They have the best food, fastest service in the entire area,  extremely reasonable and wonderful staff.
